title: Introduction - basic use
text: can create simple bar chart passing data.frame bb_barchart, first column used x-axis, second one y-axis : want create grouped bar chart, first option put data “wide” format. use stats::reshape, recommend use tidyr::spread data.table::dcast. Second option define mapping variable function bbaes (example mapping, see vignette billboarder-mapping).
code: library("billboarder")  df <- as.data.frame(table(sample(letters[1:5], 50, TRUE))) df #>   Var1 Freq #> 1    a   15 #> 2    b   10 #> 3    c    7 #> 4    d    9 #> 5    e    9  billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = df) df <- as.data.frame(table(   sample(letters[1:5], 50, TRUE),   sample(LETTERS[1:5], 50, TRUE) )) df.r <- reshape(data = df, idvar = "Var1", timevar = "Var2", direction = "wide") df.r #>   Var1 Freq.A Freq.B Freq.C Freq.D Freq.E #> 1    a      3      2      0      7      0 #> 2    b      2      1      0      2      3 #> 3    c      4      0      1      3      2 #> 4    d      2      2      2      1      2 #> 5    e      3      3      0      3      2  billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = df.r) billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(     data = df,     mapping = bbaes(x = Var1, y = Freq, group = Var2)   )

title: Introduction - basic use
text: can pass function bb_linechart vector, case x-axis index vector : can change type line argument type, example area-step : want specify variable map x-axis, pass data.frame function : first variable data.frame Date POSIX, automatically mapped x-axis :

title: Introduction - basic use
text: scatter plot, use two column data.frame function bb_scatterplot, specify x variable y variable (can also specify grouping variable) :

title: Introduction - basic use
text: pie chart, use bb_piechart two column data.frame :
code: df <- data.frame(   var = c("A", "B"),   count = c(457, 987) )  billboarder() %>%    bb_piechart(data = df)

title: Introduction - basic use
text: Donut charts works pie charts : Note : pie donut automatically sorted, can change bb_data(order = NULL).
code: df <- data.frame(   var = c("A", "B"),   count = c(687, 246) )  billboarder() %>%    bb_donutchart(data = df)

title: Introduction - basic use
Mapping - map variables to the chart
text: ’s 3 ways billboarder pass data construct chart : Use data.frame variable need used, typically barchart, first column used x-axis, second y-axis. Pass data billboarder use function bb_aes “pipe” flow. Use function bbaes inside chart builder helper bb_barchart, bb_linechart, …

title: Mapping - map variables to the chart
code: data("prod_par_filiere") str(prod_par_filiere) #> 'data.frame':    5 obs. of  11 variables: #>  $ annee             : chr  "2012" "2013" "2014" "2015" ... #>  $ prod_total        : num  542 550 540 547 531 #>  $ prod_therm        : num  48.1 43.6 25.9 34.4 45.9 #>  $ prod_hydraulique  : num  63.8 75.5 68.1 59.1 63.9 #>  $ prod_bioenergies  : num  5.8 7.1 7.5 8 8.5 #>  $ prod_eolien       : num  14.9 15.9 17.1 21.1 20.7 #>  $ prod_therm_charbon: num  17.4 19.9 8.4 8.6 7.3 #>  $ prod_solaire      : num  4.1 4.7 5.9 7.4 8.3 #>  $ prod_therm_gaz    : num  24 19.9 14.3 21.9 35.3 #>  $ prod_nucleaire    : num  405 404 416 417 384 #>  $ prod_therm_fioul  : num  6.7 3.8 3.3 3.8 3.3

title: Mapping - map variables to the chart
text: creating simple barchart, need use two columns data.frame Variable annee used x-axis, prod_bioenergies y values. similar line chart :
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = prod_par_filiere[, c("annee", "prod_bioenergies")]) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = prod_par_filiere[, c("annee", "prod_bioenergies")])

title: Mapping - map variables to the chart
text: can pass data function billboarder call bb_aes specify variable use : don’t pass arguments bb_barchart. line chart :
code: billboarder(data = prod_par_filiere) %>%    bb_aes(x = annee, y = prod_bioenergies) %>%    bb_barchart() billboarder(data = prod_par_filiere) %>%    bb_aes(x = annee, y = prod_bioenergies) %>%    bb_linechart()

title: Mapping - map variables to the chart
text: Mapping can specified inside function specify type chart : function map variables bbaes without underscore. line chart :
code: billboarder(data = prod_par_filiere) %>%    bb_barchart(mapping = bbaes(x = annee, y = prod_bioenergies)) billboarder(data = prod_par_filiere) %>%    bb_linechart(mapping = bbaes(x = annee, y = prod_bioenergies))

title: Mapping - map variables to the chart
text: Construct chart groups differ first method others. first one, data need ‘wide’ format, need data ‘long’ format grouping variable. ‘wide’ data : ‘long’ data :
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(     data = prod_par_filiere[, c("annee", "prod_bioenergies", "prod_eolien", "prod_solaire", "prod_hydraulique")]   ) # prepare data data("prod_filiere_long") prod_filiere_long <- prod_filiere_long[   prod_filiere_long$branche %in% c("bioenergies", "eolien", "solaire", "hydraulique"),  ] head(prod_filiere_long) #>    annee     branche prod #> 11  2012 hydraulique 63.8 #> 12  2013 hydraulique 75.5 #> 13  2014 hydraulique 68.1 #> 14  2015 hydraulique 59.1 #> 15  2016 hydraulique 63.9 #> 16  2012 bioenergies  5.8   billboarder(data = prod_filiere_long) %>%    bb_barchart(mapping = bbaes(x = annee, y = prod, group = branche))

title: Mapping - map variables to the chart
text: Shiny app function, can use bbaes_string bb_aes_string, function accept character instead unquoted variable names :
code: billboarder(data = prod_filiere_long) %>%    bb_barchart(mapping = bbaes_string(x = "annee", y = "prod", group = "branche"))

title: Options - styling charts
text: Add title chart bb_title bb_labs (bb_labs shortcut set title axis labels time, options placement) :
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(table(sample(letters[1:6], 50, TRUE))) %>%    bb_title(text = "My title", position = "center")

title: Options - styling charts
text: can specify new color palette function bb_color : can specify color associated data bb_colors_manual : Note : careful using named colors, CSS don’t recognize color variant royalblue2, firebrick3, … Use HEX code instead. bar charts, can highlight value simple barchart :
code: data("prod_par_filiere") prod_par_filiere[, c(1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8)] #>   annee prod_therm prod_hydraulique prod_bioenergies prod_eolien prod_solaire #> 1  2012       48.1             63.8              5.8        14.9          4.1 #> 2  2013       43.6             75.5              7.1        15.9          4.7 #> 3  2014       25.9             68.1              7.5        17.1          5.9 #> 4  2015       34.4             59.1              8.0        21.1          7.4 #> 5  2016       45.9             63.9              8.5        20.7          8.3  # Default billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = prod_par_filiere[, c(1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8)]) billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = prod_par_filiere[, c(1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8)]) %>%    bb_colors_manual(     prod_therm = "maroon",     prod_hydraulique = "royalblue",     prod_bioenergies = "forestgreen",     prod_eolien = "plum",     prod_solaire = "goldenrod"   ) billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = prod_par_filiere[, c(1, 4)], color = "grey") %>%    bb_bar_color_manual(values = c("2015" = "firebrick"))

title: Options - styling charts
text: Add label axis : can format values axis JavaScript (use htmlwidgets::JS mark character string literal JavaScript) : just want add suffix prefix value, use functions name : can apply format x axis well (especially useful time), fit = FALSE don’t show ticks : Set minimum axis (look difference x-axis , without fit = FALSE) :
code: # data source : wikipedia sw <- data.frame(   film = c("The Force Awakens", "The Phantom Menace",            "Revenge of the Sith", "A New Hope",             "Attack of the Clones", "The Empire Strikes Back",             "Return of the Jedi"),   worldwide_gross = c(2068178225, 1027044677, 848754768,                       775398007, 649398328, 538375067, 475106177) )  billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = sw) %>%    bb_y_axis(label = list(text = "Worldwide grosses", position = "outer-middle")) billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = sw) %>%    bb_y_axis(tick = list(     values = c(0, 5e+08, 1e+09, 1.5e+09, 2e+09),     outer = FALSE,     format = htmlwidgets::JS("d3.formatPrefix('$,.0', 1e6)")   )) sw2 <- sw # calculate percentage sw2$percent <- sw2$worldwide_gross / sum(sw2$worldwide_gross) * 100 sw2$percent <- round(sw2$percent)  sw2$worldwide_gross <- NULL  billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = sw2) %>%    bb_y_axis(tick = list(format = suffix("%"))) data("cdc_prod_filiere") billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = cdc_prod_filiere[, c("date_heure", "prod_solaire")]) %>%    bb_x_axis(tick = list(format = "%H:%M", fit = FALSE)) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = cdc_prod_filiere[, c("date_heure", "prod_solaire")]) %>%    bb_y_axis(min = 0, padding = 0)

title: Options - styling charts
text: default, legend shown, can hide bb_lengend can change name appearing legend bb_data, giving alias variable data. column named cos data.frame, renamed Cosine. Legend can postionned argument position, three values possible : "bottom" (default), "right" "inset". last one, must specify area chart legend must placed.
code: df <- data.frame(   cos = cos(seq(-pi, pi, length.out = 30)) )  # No legend billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = df) %>%    bb_legend(show = FALSE) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = df) %>%    bb_data(names = list(cos = "Cosine")) df$sin <- sin(seq(-pi, pi, length.out = 30))  billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = df) %>%    bb_legend(position = "right")

title: Options - styling charts
text: can add grids chart bb_x_axis bb_y_axis : option also allows add vertical horizontal lines :
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = df) %>%   bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%    bb_x_grid(show = TRUE) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = df) %>%   bb_y_grid(lines = list(     list(value = 0, text = "Zero")   ))

title: Options - styling charts
text: can show tooltip separately serie chart : can change format tooltip JavaScript function, example d3.format. Write function character vector, use htmlwidgets::JS mark literal JavaScript code.
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = df) %>%   bb_tooltip(grouped = FALSE) billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = sw) %>%    bb_tooltip(format = list(     name =  htmlwidgets::JS("function(name, ratio, id, index) {return 'Worldwide grosses';}"),     value = htmlwidgets::JS("d3.format('$,')")   ))

title: Options - styling charts
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_barchart(data = sw, color = "#CAD5DB") %>%    bb_bar_color_manual(values = c("A New Hope" = "#112446")) %>%    bb_legend(show = FALSE) %>%    bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%    bb_y_axis(tick = list(     values = c(0, 5e+08, 1e+09, 1.5e+09, 2e+09),     outer = FALSE,     format = htmlwidgets::JS("d3.formatPrefix('$,.0', 1e6)")   )) %>%    bb_tooltip(format = list(     name =  htmlwidgets::JS("function(name, ratio, id, index) {return 'Worldwide grosses';}"),     value = htmlwidgets::JS("d3.format('$,')")   )) %>%    bb_labs(     title = "Star Wars - Total Lifetime Grosses",      y = "Worldwide grosses",     caption = "Data source : wikipedia"   )

title: billboarder
text: Create barcharts bb_barchart : create dodge barchart, data “wide” format, can use following (otherwise reshape data “long” format, tools pivot_longer): principle stacked bar charts :
code: library(billboarder)  # data data("prod_par_filiere")  billboarder(data = prod_par_filiere) %>%   bb_barchart(     mapping = aes(x = annee, y = prod_hydraulique),     color = "#102246"   ) %>%   bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%   bb_y_axis(     tick = list(format = suffix("TWh")),     label = list(text = "production (in terawatt-hours)", position = "outer-top")   ) %>%    bb_legend(show = FALSE) %>%    bb_labs(     title = "French hydraulic production",     caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)"   ) library(billboarder)  # data data("prod_par_filiere")  billboarder() %>%   bb_barchart(     data = prod_par_filiere[, c("annee", "prod_hydraulique", "prod_eolien", "prod_solaire")]   ) %>%   bb_data(     names = list(prod_hydraulique = "Hydraulic", prod_eolien = "Wind", prod_solaire = "Solar")   ) %>%    bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%     bb_y_axis(     tick = list(format = suffix("TWh")),     label = list(text = "production (in terawatt-hours)", position = "outer-top")   ) %>%    bb_legend(position = "inset", inset = list(anchor = "top-right")) %>%    bb_labs(     title = "Renewable energy production",     caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)"   ) library(billboarder)  # data data("prod_par_filiere")  # stacked bar chart ! billboarder() %>%   bb_barchart(     data = prod_par_filiere[, c("annee", "prod_hydraulique", "prod_eolien", "prod_solaire")],      stacked = TRUE   ) %>%   bb_data(     names = list(prod_hydraulique = "Hydraulic", prod_eolien = "Wind", prod_solaire = "Solar"),      labels = TRUE   ) %>%    bb_colors_manual(     "prod_eolien" = "#41AB5D", "prod_hydraulique" = "#4292C6", "prod_solaire" = "#FEB24C"   ) %>%   bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%     bb_y_axis(     tick = list(format = suffix("TWh")),     label = list(text = "production (in terawatt-hours)", position = "outer-top")   ) %>%    bb_legend(position = "inset", inset = list(anchor = "top-right")) %>%    bb_labs(     title = "Renewable energy production",     caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)"   )

title: billboarder
text: classic one: can make bubble chart using size aes :
code: billboarder() %>%   bb_scatterplot(    data = mtcars,     x = "wt", y = "mpg", group = "cyl",    point_opacity = 1  ) %>%    # don't display all values on x-axis  bb_axis(x = list(tick = list(fit = FALSE))) %>%   bb_point(r = 5) %>%    # add grids   bb_x_grid(show = TRUE) %>%   bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) billboarder(data = mtcars) %>%    bb_scatterplot(    mapping = aes(wt, mpg, group = cyl, size = scales::rescale(qsec, to = c(0.2, 7))),    point_opacity = 1   ) %>%    bb_axis(x = list(tick = list(fit = FALSE))) %>%    bb_x_grid(show = TRUE) %>%   bb_y_grid(show = TRUE)

title: billboarder
text: Create pie charts : can also donut charts :
code: library(billboarder)  # data data("prod_par_filiere") nuclear2016 <- data.frame(   sources = c("Nuclear", "Other"),   production = c(     prod_par_filiere$prod_nucleaire[prod_par_filiere$annee == "2016"],     prod_par_filiere$prod_total[prod_par_filiere$annee == "2016"] -       prod_par_filiere$prod_nucleaire[prod_par_filiere$annee == "2016"]   ) )  # pie chart ! billboarder() %>%    bb_piechart(data = nuclear2016) %>%    bb_labs(title = "Share of nuclear power in France in 2016",           caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)") billboarder() %>%    bb_donutchart(data = nuclear2016) %>%    bb_donut(     title = "Share of nuclear power\nin France in 2016",     label = list(       format = JS("function(value, ratio, id) { return id + ': ' + d3.format('.0%')(ratio);}")     )   ) %>%    bb_legend(show = FALSE) %>%    bb_labs(caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)")

what: Time serie with Date (and a subchart)
title: billboarder
code: library(billboarder)  # data data("equilibre_mensuel")  # line chart billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = equilibre_mensuel[, c("date", "consommation", "production")],      type = "spline"   ) %>%    bb_x_axis(tick = list(format = "%Y-%m", fit = FALSE)) %>%    bb_x_grid(show = TRUE) %>%    bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%    bb_colors_manual("consommation" = "firebrick", "production" = "forestgreen") %>%    bb_legend(position = "right") %>%    bb_subchart(show = TRUE, size = list(height = 30)) %>%    bb_labs(title = "Monthly electricity consumption and production in France (2007 - 2017)",           y = "In megawatt (MW)",           caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)")

title: billboarder
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = equilibre_mensuel[, c("date", "consommation", "production")],      type = "spline"   ) %>%    bb_x_axis(tick = list(format = "%Y-%m", fit = FALSE)) %>%    bb_x_grid(show = TRUE) %>%    bb_y_grid(show = TRUE) %>%    bb_colors_manual("consommation" = "firebrick", "production" = "forestgreen") %>%    bb_legend(position = "right") %>%    bb_zoom(     enabled = list(type = "drag"),     resetButton = list(text = "Unzoom")   ) %>%    bb_labs(title = "Monthly electricity consumption and production in France (2007 - 2017)",           y = "In megawatt (MW)",           caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)")

title: billboarder
code: library(billboarder)  # data data("cdc_prod_filiere")  # Retrieve sunrise and and sunset data with `suncalc` # library("suncalc") # sun <- getSunlightTimes(date = as.Date("2017-06-12"), lat = 48.86, lon = 2.34, tz = "CET") sun <- data.frame(   sunrise = as.POSIXct("2017-06-12 05:48:14"),   sunset = as.POSIXct("2017-06-12 21:55:32") )   # line chart billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = cdc_prod_filiere,     mapping = aes(date_heure, prod_solaire)   ) %>%    bb_x_axis(tick = list(format = "%H:%M", fit = FALSE)) %>%    bb_y_axis(min = 0, padding = 0) %>%    bb_regions(     list(       start = as.numeric(cdc_prod_filiere$date_heure[1]) * 1000,       end = as.numeric(sun$sunrise)*1000     ),      list(       start = as.numeric(sun$sunset) * 1000,        end = as.numeric(cdc_prod_filiere$date_heure[48]) * 1000     )   ) %>%    bb_x_grid(     lines = list(       list(value = as.numeric(sun$sunrise)*1000, text = "sunrise"),       list(value = as.numeric(sun$sunset)*1000, text = "sunset")     )   ) %>%    bb_labs(title = "Solar production (2017-06-12)",           y = "In megawatt (MW)",           caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)")

title: billboarder
code: library(billboarder)  # data data("cdc_prod_filiere")  billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = cdc_prod_filiere[, c("date_heure", "prod_eolien", "prod_hydraulique", "prod_solaire")],      type = "area"   ) %>%    bb_data(     groups = list(list("prod_eolien", "prod_hydraulique", "prod_solaire")),     names = list("prod_eolien" = "Wind", "prod_hydraulique" = "Hydraulic", "prod_solaire" = "Solar")   ) %>%    bb_legend(position = "inset", inset = list(anchor = "top-right")) %>%    bb_colors_manual(     "prod_eolien" = "#238443", "prod_hydraulique" = "#225EA8", "prod_solaire" = "#FEB24C",      opacity = 0.8   ) %>%    bb_y_axis(min = 0, padding = 0) %>%    bb_labs(title = "Renewable energy production (2017-06-12)",           y = "In megawatt (MW)",           caption = "Data source: RTE (https://opendata.rte-france.com)")

title: billboarder
code: # Generate data dat <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(Sys.Date(), length.out = 20, by = "day"),   y1 = round(rnorm(20, 100, 15)),   y2 = round(rnorm(20, 100, 15)) ) dat$ymin1 <- dat$y1 - 5 dat$ymax1 <- dat$y1 + 5  dat$ymin2 <- dat$y2 - sample(3:15, 20, TRUE) dat$ymax2 <- dat$y2 + sample(3:15, 20, TRUE)   # Make chart : use ymin & ymax aes for range billboarder(data = dat) %>%    bb_linechart(     mapping = aes(x = date, y = y1, ymin = ymin1, ymax = ymax1),     type = "area-line-range"   ) %>%    bb_linechart(     mapping = aes(x = date, y = y2, ymin = ymin2, ymax = ymax2),      type = "area-spline-range"   ) %>%    bb_y_axis(min = 50)

title: billboarder
text: Create histograms numeric vector (data.frame) : grouping variable : Density plot data :
code: billboarder() %>%   bb_histogram(data = rnorm(1e5), binwidth = 0.25) %>%   bb_colors_manual() # Generate some data dat <- data.frame(   sample = c(rnorm(n = 1e4, mean = 1), rnorm(n = 1e4, mean = 2)),   group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 1e4), stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) # Mean by groups samples_mean <- tapply(dat$sample, dat$group, mean) # histogram ! billboarder() %>%   bb_histogram(data = dat, x = "sample", group = "group", binwidth = 0.25) %>%   bb_x_grid(     lines = list(       list(value = unname(samples_mean['A']), text = "mean of sample A"),       list(value = unname(samples_mean['B']), text = "mean of sample B")     )   ) billboarder() %>%   bb_densityplot(data = dat, x = "sample", group = "group") %>%   bb_x_grid(     lines = list(       list(value = unname(samples_mean['A']), text = "mean of sample A"),       list(value = unname(samples_mean['B']), text = "mean of sample B")     )   )

title: Lines options
text: can change type line type argument, available choices : line, spline, step, area, area-spline, area-step, area-line-range, area-spline-range. examples : can use different types lines : mapping :
code: billboarder(height = "200px") %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, type = "spline") billboarder(height = "200px") %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, type = "step") billboarder(height = "200px") %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, type = "area") billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, type = c("area", "spline", "step")) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = long,      mapping = bbaes(index, value, group = time),     type = c("area", "spline", "step")   )

title: Lines options
text: can use pattern dashes gaps line specifying argument dasharray. Possible values : numeric : length dashes length gaps character format "x1 y1 x2..." : first dash length x1, following gap length y1, … Example : use different patterns, use vector length data (use 0 dash) : mapping :
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, dasharray = 4) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, dasharray = "6 2 1 2") billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, dasharray = c("0", "4 2", "8 3 2 3")) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = long,      mapping = bbaes(index, value, group = time),     dasharray = c("2", "4 2", "8 3 2 3")   )

title: Lines options
text: Lines width can define width argument : Use vector length lines use different widths : mapping :
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, width = 3) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(data = wide, width = c(1, 4, 8)) billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = long,      mapping = bbaes(index, value, group = time),     width = c(1, 4, 8)   )

title: Lines options
code: billboarder() %>%    bb_linechart(     data = long,      mapping = bbaes(index, value, group = time),     dasharray = c("2", "4 2", "8 3 2 3"),     width = c(1, 4, 8)   )

what: Create Interactive Chart with the JavaScript Billboard Library

Power ratings for The Avengers. — avengers
text: data frame 24 rows 4 variables: group Name hero axis Power skill value Value (1-7) description Character description object class data.frame 6 rows 5 columns.

title: Power ratings for The Avengers. — avengers
Shiny bindings for bauge — bauge-shiny
text: Output render functions using bauge within Shiny applications interactive Rmd documents.

title: Shiny bindings for bauge — bauge-shiny
code: baugeOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = "200px")  renderBauge(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)

title: Shiny bindings for bauge — bauge-shiny
Shiny bindings for bauge — bauge-shiny
text: width, height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number, coerced string 'px' appended.

title: Shiny bindings for bauge — bauge-shiny
Shiny bindings for bauge — bauge-shiny

text: data frame 48 rows 11 variables: date_heure Timestamp (POSIXct) prod_total Total production MW (thermal + hydro + nuclear + solar + wind + bioenergy) prod_gaz Gas production MW prod_bioenergies Bioenergy production MW prod_hydraulique Hydraulic production MW prod_thermique_fossile Fossil thermal production MW prod_charbon Coal production MW prod_eolien Wind production MW prod_solaire Solar production MW prod_nucleaire Nuclear production MW prod_fioul Oil production MW

billboarder 0.3.2
text: Update billboard.js library 3.2.0, see release note Update billboard.js library 3.1.1, see release note Fixed bug export outside shiny.

title: billboarder 0.3.1
text: Update billboard.js library 3.0.1, see release note

title: billboarder 0.3.0
text: Update billboard.js library 2.2.2, see release note New theme available: datalab. New function set_color_palette() define default colors used charts. ’s now possible use aes() directly define mapping aesthetics. Deprecated bb_proxy_transform().

title: billboarder 0.2.9
text: Update billboard.js library 1.12.8, see release note. bb_labs() lower part caption cut added argument caption_href add link.

title: billboarder 0.2.8
text: Update billboard.js library 1.11.1, see release note. bb_export() : new function export chart PNG Shiny applications proxy adding “download” button chart. bb_linechart() two new arguments: dasharray (use dash lines) width control lines size. New vignette describe lines options, use vignette("lines-options", package = "billboarder") display .

title: billboarder 0.2.7
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.10.0, see release note Upgrade billboard library 1.9.0, see release note

title: billboarder 0.2.7
text: Bubbles (using size aesthetic bb_scatterplot) now computed JavaScript, argument range deprecated.

title: billboarder 0.2.6
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.8.0 (color , linear gradient area charts, multiline text labels, bar width), see release note New function bauge : gauge automatically updates Shiny apps.

title: billboarder 0.2.5
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.7.0 (new theme, multiple axes, normalized staking data), see release note

title: billboarder 0.2.4
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.6.2 New function set_theme choose global theme charts.

title: billboarder 0.2.3
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.5.1 Support radar chart: bb_radarchart. Linked tooltip, see Gist demo.

title: billboarder 0.2.2
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.4.1 Support area-line-range area-spline-range bb_linechart

title: billboarder 0.2.1
text: Upgrade billboard library 1.2.0, D3V4 4.12.2 New proxy methods : bb_proxy_data_colors bb_proxy_data_names. New aesthetic scatterplots : size, make bubble clouds.

title: billboarder 0.1.0
text: New charts type : lollipop, histogram density plot. methods proxy examples, see proxy_example details. Upgrade billboard.js 1.1.1. New functions bbaes bb_aes map data chart, see corresponding vignette.
